title: Apigenin-induced Apoptosis in Lung Adenocarcinoma A549 Cells: Involvement in IFNA2, TNF, and SPON2 With Different Time Points.
abstract: Apigenin, found in a variety of vegetables and fruits, exhibits anti-oxidant, anti-inflammatory and anticancer effects. Recently, we reported the possibility that apigenin induces apoptosis in human lung adenocarcinoma A549 cells through the miR-34a-5p/SNAI1/caspase-3/-7 pathway. Understanding how apigenin triggers apoptosis in cancer cells will help lay the groundwork for developing effective cancer treatments.
